title: Everyday English Course 40
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: Where is the exhibition been held?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: How much is an airmail letter to Japan?
W: I'll have to check. Can I help you with anything else?
M: I'd like a 20-cent stamp, please.
W: There you are.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: How much is an airmail letter to Japan?
W: I'll have to check. Can I help you with anything else?
M: I'd like a 20-cent stamp, please.
W: There you are.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: How much is an airmail letter to Japan?
W: I'll have to check. Can I help you with anything else?
M: I'd like a 20-cent stamp, please.
W: There you are.
{a}

variables.a: Where are the two speakers?

answerOptions: She will drive the man to the supermarket.
The man should buy a car of his own.
The man needn't go shopping every week.
instances.correctAnswer: She will drive the man to the supermarket.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: He always finds good places to eat.
He always makes reservations for dinner.
He read a book while he was eating dinner.
instances.correctAnswer: He always finds good places to eat.

variables.a: What does the woman say about John?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Could you tell me how much it is to send a postcard by airmail to Europe?
W: Twenty five cents.
M: OK, I'd like two 25 cent stamps, please.
W: Here you are.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Could you tell me how much it is to send a postcard by airmail to Europe?
W: Twenty five cents.
M: OK, I'd like two 25 cent stamps, please.
W: Here you are.
{a}

W: Twenty five cents.
M: OK, I'd like two 25 cent stamps, please.
W: Here you are.
{a}

answerOptions: He is buying plane tickets to Europe.
He is asking about his mail.

variables.a: What is the man doing?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: I'll have a glass of wine please, and my friend will have a beer.
M: Would you like them now or during your meal?
W: Bring them to us now, please.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: I'll have a glass of wine please, and my friend will have a beer.
M: Would you like them now or during your meal?
W: Bring them to us now, please.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: I'll have a glass of wine please, and my friend will have a beer.
M: Would you like them now or during your meal?
W: Bring them to us now, please.
{a}

variables.a: What does the woman want to drink?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Excuse me. Can I have change for a dollar, please?
M: Sorry, but I can only give you change if you buy something.
W: But I only have a dollar on me, and all I need is four quarters.
M: Sorry, but I don't make the rules.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Excuse me. Can I have change for a dollar, please?
M: Sorry, but I can only give you change if you buy something.
W: But I only have a dollar on me, and all I need is four quarters.
M: Sorry, but I don't make the rules.
{a}

M: Sorry, but I can only give you change if you buy something.
W: But I only have a dollar on me, and all I need is four quarters.
M: Sorry, but I don't make the rules.
{a}

variables.a: Where are the speakers?

answerOptions: She talked with the consultant about the new program until two.
She couldn't talk to the consultant before two.
She would talk to the consultant during lunch.
instances.correctAnswer: She couldn't talk to the consultant before two.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?
How did the woman feel about the man?
Where did she found her book?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What's the relationship between the man and the woman?

answerOptions: The library no longer had the book on reserve.
The library closed earlier than he'd expected.
The professor had chosen a mystery book for him instead.
instances.correctAnswer: The library closed earlier than he'd expected.

variables.a: What does the man mean?
When will the woman discuss her class project with the man?
What did the boy's father do last week?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Does Jane still play the violin?
W: Yes. She's practising it every day.
M: You should be happy then.
W: Yeah. It's Bob that's worried about. He really wants to buy drums. But he thinks we spent all that money on the guitar and he has hardly used it.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Does Jane still play the violin?
W: Yes. She's practising it every day.
M: You should be happy then.
W: Yeah. It's Bob that's worried about. He really wants to buy drums. But he thinks we spent all that money on the guitar and he has hardly used it.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: Does Jane still play the violin?
W: Yes. She's practising it every day.
M: You should be happy then.
W: Yeah. It's Bob that's worried about. He really wants to buy drums. But he thinks we spent all that money on the guitar and he has hardly used it.
{a}

variables.a: Which musical instrument does Bob have?
What's the relationship between the two speakers?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Good morning, can I help you?
M: Yes, I'd like to know something about the weather in New York this week.
W: Well, it's fairly hot and there's much rain in the evenings.
M: I see, thanks very much for your help.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Good morning, can I help you?
M: Yes, I'd like to know something about the weather in New York this week.
W: Well, it's fairly hot and there's much rain in the evenings.
M: I see, thanks very much for your help.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Good morning, can I help you?
M: Yes, I'd like to know something about the weather in New York this week.
W: Well, it's fairly hot and there's much rain in the evenings.
M: I see, thanks very much for your help.
{a}

variables.a: What's the weather like in New York these days?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: I'm afraid I have a complaint to make.
W: Yes sir?
M: I don't believe the food is cooked enough.
W: Sorry, I'll bring you another.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: I'm afraid I have a complaint to make.
W: Yes sir?
M: I don't believe the food is cooked enough.
W: Sorry, I'll bring you another.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: I'm afraid I have a complaint to make.
W: Yes sir?
M: I don't believe the food is cooked enough.
W: Sorry, I'll bring you another.
{a}

answerOptions: The food is not cooked enough.
instances.correctAnswer: The food is not cooked enough.

variables.a: What are they talking about?

answerOptions: He has bought the wrong book.
He has lost half of his money.
instances.correctAnswer: He has bought the wrong book.

variables.a: What has the man done?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: I'm going to buy a new carpet.
M: But you can't do that.
W: Why can't I?
M: We haven't got enough money.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: I'm going to buy a new carpet.
M: But you can't do that.
W: Why can't I?
M: We haven't got enough money.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: I'm going to buy a new carpet.
M: But you can't do that.
W: Why can't I?
M: We haven't got enough money.
{a}

answerOptions: Because they don't have enough money.
Because the woman doesn't have time.
Because the woman knows he doesn't have money.
instances.correctAnswer: Because they don't have enough money.

variables.a: Why can't the woman buy it?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: Where are they talking?

answerOptions: She is not interested in computer programming.
She has never signed up for any competition before.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation about the woman?
What made the woman late?

answerOptions: She can't be Lucy because Lucy is on holiday.
instances.correctAnswer: She can't be Lucy because Lucy is on holiday.

variables.a: What does the woman say about the girl?

answerOptions: He thinks that the tickets near the stage have been sold out-
He doesn't want to sit near the stage.
He means it is not easy at all to get tickets.
instances.correctAnswer: He means it is not easy at all to get tickets.

variables.a: What does the man mean?
What time is it?

answerOptions: Risks may exist when they chase high profits in a short time.
It's feasible for people to be after large short-term profits.
No one can avoid being victims of financial tricks.
instances.correctAnswer: Risks may exist when they chase high profits in a short time.

variables.a: What does the man think people should know?
What subject does the woman think less difficult?
What does the man think of advertising on TV?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Hi, Susan, Where were you at lunch time?
W: Oh, sorry to miss you. But my thirst for knowledge was greater than my stomach for food.
M: I never have that problem. So where were you?
W: My science class ran over.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Hi, Susan, Where were you at lunch time?
W: Oh, sorry to miss you. But my thirst for knowledge was greater than my stomach for food.
M: I never have that problem. So where were you?
W: My science class ran over.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: Hi, Susan, Where were you at lunch time?
W: Oh, sorry to miss you. But my thirst for knowledge was greater than my stomach for food.
M: I never have that problem. So where were you?
W: My science class ran over.
{a}

answerOptions: She tried to solve the problem.
She had a chat with her classmate.

variables.a: What did the woman do at lunchtime?
